moves.1. d4 f5 2. c4 Nf6 3. g3 g6 4. Bg2 Bg7 5: This was not really a good move, because of  8. ...  Nh5 , losing a tempo. I should have played 8.e3 right away, or maybe 8. b4.
moves.8... Na6: Planning to manoeuvre the knight to e6 via c7.
moves.9. Ng5: I played this only to provoke the h6 push,  creating a weakness on g6 that I could play against.
moves.9... h6 10. Nf3 Nc7 11. Rc1 Ne6 12. Be3: Avoiding the exchange. Also, I wanted the d-file to be cleared between my queen and my pawn to prepare d5.
moves.12... Nh5: Here, my opponent opened the diagonal for his bishop and add some pressure on the f4 square.
moves.13. Qd3 Qe8 14. Nh4: I put some pressure on g6 and open the way for my next move.
moves.14... a5: My opponent started to play on the queenside while all the action is on the kingside.
moves.15. f4 Nf6: Now that pushing his own pawn to f4 is no more possible he take back his knight.
moves.16. d5: At this point I had noticed that his queen was the only piece to protect the g6 and e7 pawns. So, I found a way to bring a knight to d5, and to win a pawn.
moves.16... cxd5 17. Bxd5 Nxd5 18. Nxd5 Ra6: This move is quite a loss of time. Trying to solidify the kingside with a move like Kh7 was much more urgent.
moves.19. Nxg6: Here, if Qxg6 then Nxe7 + followed by Nxg6.
moves.19... Rf7: The only move to keep the quality.
moves.20... Rc6: Here, Vulgaire send me a comment thinking that I had missed the fork, but c7 was covered by his knight.
moves.21. Bd2: Planning Bc3 to challenge the a1-h8 diagonal.
moves.21... Nd4: Here is why 20. Rb1 was better.
moves.22. Rcc1 e6 23. Ne3 b6 24. Bc3: Threatening to win a piece, forcing e5, and by the way the opening of the f-file.
moves.24... e5 25. fxe5 dxe5 26. Nh4: Aiming directly the new weakness, f5.
moves.26... Rcf6: Here 26. ... Rc5!? would have been interesting.
moves.29. Nd5: Temporary closing the d-file, and attacking the f6 square. Here f5 is about to fall.
moves.31... Rxf4 32. Rxf4 Bb7: The lonely white bishop finally enter the battle but it was already too late.
moves.33. Nf5: Forking the rook and the bishop.
moves.33... Rg6: Trying to save the rook but I could have played Ne7+, but I had another idea.
moves.34. Nxg7 Qxg7: He can't recapture with the rook because of Nf6+ winning the queen.
moves.35. Qxg6: Here, my opponent resigned. It would continue with 35. ... Qxg6 36. Ne7+ Kg7 37. Nxg6 Kxg6 38.Rxd4 ... Hard to continue a game with 3 pawns and a quality down.
